examples: Congratulations, Rhett, you get to hug Zach Braff!
Where am I? - Congratulations.
I almost bid against myself twice. - Congratulations, Link. -
- Congratulations, I was running a secret investigation to smoke out the rat in this unit, and you just blew my cover.
And we're gonna sign that thing and send you a GMM poster and mug! - Congratulations! - (laughs) Woohoo!
words.defineEn: an expression of joy or approval offered to someone to acknowledge their achievement, success, or good fortune
words.defineVi: một biểu hiện của niềm vui hoặc sự chấp thuận dành cho ai đó để thừa nhận thành tích, thành công hoặc may mắn của họ

examples: The hole calls the thief.
The organization called the new regulations a turning point in the campaign against smoking.
To call a meeting/strike.
A classic hot chocolate recipe calls for scalded milk to be mixed with cocoa powder and sugar.
You call that mercy?
words.defineEn: to give a name to an animal or a baby
words.defineVi: đặt tên cho một con vật hoặc một em bé

examples: The brain weighs about three pounds.
Congress weighed the pros and cons of the new tax plan.
He spoke very slowly, weighing his words.
He gave evidence to the court, weighing each word as he spoke.
I've been weighing his words all day, trying to figure out what he meant.
words.defineEn: to discover how heavy someone or something is
words.defineVi: để khám phá xem ai đó hoặc cái gì đó nặng như thế nào

examples: The wedding ceremony went off without a hitch.
The bride's wedding dress is white.
The wedding celebrations went like a dream.
My brother's heartbreak is casting a cloud over my wedding.
My grandparents celebrated their sixtieth wedding anniversary.
words.defineEn: the event of a marriage ceremony
words.defineVi: sự kiện của một lễ cưới

examples: He's very engaged in environmental issues and volunteers for a local conservation group.
He always sits in the front row during class to stay focused and engaged.
And she became more and more engaged.
and she’s an engaged teacher.
He's always interested in a lot of different things, but those things which he's really interested in, politics and family and faith and sports, he gets deeply engaged.
words.defineEn: having formally agreed to marry someone
words.defineVi: đã chính thức đồng ý kết hôn với ai đó

examples: Danish Blue cheese is fantastic in vegetarian dishes.
The vibrant hue of damson makes it a fantastic ingredient for homemade fruit popsicles.
Take time by the forelock and accept that fantastic internship!
She told me that yeast extract is a fantastic seasoning substitute for reducing sodium in my meals.
All my friends agree that Gruyère is a fantastic melting cheese.
words.defineEn: extremely amazing and great
words.defineVi: cực kỳ tuyệt vời và tuyệt vời

examples: The news really made my day.
These dogs seldom make the news.
The news spread like wildfire.
News of interest cuts came in the nick of time for borrowers.
The news came hot on the heels of another plane crash.
words.defineEn: reports on recent events that are broadcast or published
words.defineVi: báo cáo về các sự kiện gần đây được phát sóng hoặc xuất bản

examples: I have a friend's wedding, I'm a bridesmaid.
Once there, Thrym threw his new bride and her bridesmaid, Loki, a wedding feast.
You make a great bridesmaid, but you'd never actually wear this to a date, right?
But now we're best friends, I'm gonna have you be my bridesmaids, you proved to me that you can do it.
words.defineEn: a woman or girl chosen by a bride to help her at her wedding
words.defineVi: một người phụ nữ hoặc cô gái được cô dâu chọn để giúp cô ấy trong đám cưới của cô ấy

examples: The name rings a bell.
The children enjoyed onion rings as a crispy side dish.
This should ring alarm bells in all European countries and the United States.
Your phone is ringing for the thousandth time.
His complaints have a familiar ring.
words.defineEn: a piece of jewelry that we wear on our finger, consisting of a round, small band of metal (gold, silver, etc.), and often decorated with precious stones
words.defineVi: một món đồ trang sức mà chúng ta đeo trên ngón tay, bao gồm một dải kim loại tròn, nhỏ (vàng, bạc, v.v.) và thường được trang trí bằng đá quý

examples: The purple flowers in the vase were beautiful.
My mom planted beautiful flowers in the front yard.
It's beautiful!
The train traveled through beautiful countryside.
The vibrant purple color of whinberries adds a beautiful touch to desserts like cheesecakes and tarts.
words.defineEn: extremely pleasing to the mind or senses
words.defineVi: cực kỳ dễ chịu cho tâm trí hoặc các giác quan

examples: My job is the tough one.
The boss is very tough on anyone who steps out of line.
She is made of tougher stuff.
The team's defense is a tough nut to crack.
Long hours and tough working conditions are often par for the course in catering.
words.defineEn: difficult to achieve or deal with
words.defineVi: khó khăn để đạt được hoặc đối phó với

examples: Things like this take time.
Time is moving on.
The time passed quickly.
Time to bust a move.
The contractor is really taking their time.
words.defineEn: the quantity that is measured in seconds, minutes, hours, etc. using a device like clock
words.defineVi: số lượng được đo bằng giây, phút, giờ, v.v. bằng thiết bị như đồng hồ

examples: Can you split up the check?
Her parents essentially split up as soon as she was born.
Wilcox splits up the meat based on type.
Or however phone numbers are split up in your area.
For one thing, the scientists didn’t split up the prisoners randomly and put half in pink rooms and the other half in, say, white rooms.
words.defineEn: to end a romantic relationship or marriage
words.defineVi: để kết thúc một mối quan hệ lãng mạn hoặc hôn nhân

examples: "Sorry, I've run out."
Sorry, I'm still really groggy.
Sorry, what did you say?
Sorry, I don't follow.
Sorry, could you please hand me the book?
words.defineEn: feeling ashamed or sad about something that one has or has not done
words.defineVi: cảm thấy xấu hổ hoặc buồn về điều gì đó mà một người đã hoặc chưa làm

examples: I heard the tiny squeak of a mouse in the walls.
I hear the sound of seagulls near the sea.
To hear both sides of the argument.
The Supreme Court heard the case on Tuesday.
Have you heard the news?
words.defineEn: to be told or receive information or news regarding something
words.defineVi: được nói hoặc nhận thông tin hoặc tin tức về một cái gì đó

examples: She often gets on her soapbox about environmental issues.
she gets on the stick very quickly.
It really gets on my nerves.
They got on bad terms after an argument.
Don't get on your high horse with me.
words.defineEn: to have a good, friendly, or smooth relationship with a person, group, or animal
words.defineVi: để có một mối quan hệ tốt, thân thiện, hoặc suôn sẻ với một người, nhóm, hoặc động vật

examples: The horse took the first fence well.
Generally, the article reads very well.
The car holds the corners very well.
The glue is taking well.
In this grim little episode, few people come out well.
words.defineEn: in a way that is right, good, or satisfactory
words.defineVi: trong một cách đó là đúng, tốt, hoặc thỏa đáng

examples: The report names and shames companies that are not doing enough to fight industrial pollution.
Pardon my French, but that's a damned shame!
The teacher encouraged their students to tell the truth and shame the devil, even if it meant admitting to cheating or plagiarism.
Look, I'm just as upset as anyone, but I'm not willing to take part in some name and shame against everyone in the neighborhood!
The time limit is shame.
words.defineEn: an uneasy feeling that we get because of our own or someone else's mistake or bad manner
words.defineVi: một cảm giác khó chịu mà chúng ta có được do sai lầm hoặc cách cư xử tồi tệ của chính mình hoặc của người khác

examples: There's a lovely park right on our doorstep.
She was a lovely woman and my mother truly enjoyed her company.
I have been as busy as a beaver these last few weeks crocheting up custom orders for some lovely customers.
They’ve let that lovely old house fall to pieces around them.
The rose was pink and had a lovely scent.
words.defineEn: delightful, enjoyable, or pleasurable in experience or quality
words.defineVi: thú vị, thú vị, hoặc thú vị trong kinh nghiệm hoặc chất lượng

examples: Maybe this photograph will jog your memory.
Memories of that day still bring a lump to his throat.
The memory of all that blood made his flesh creep.
These events occurred within living memory.
As I bit into the mombin, its fibrous texture and tropical taste brought back childhood memories.
words.defineEn: the ability of mind to keep and remember past events, people, experiences, etc.
words.defineVi: khả năng lưu giữ và ghi nhớ các sự kiện, con người, kinh nghiệm trong quá khứ, v.v.

examples: Together, the ant colony was greater than the sum of its parts.
They play the guitar together during jam sessions.
The family took a vacation together, creating wonderful memories with their children.
They did everything together.
They stayed together for the sake of the children.
words.defineEn: near to or with something or someone else
words.defineVi: gần hoặc với một cái gì đó hoặc người khác

examples: There existed no organization to cope with espionage.
A good source of tried and true tips on how to cope with the various aspects of the illness.
When my grandmother passed away, I found comfort in reading books as a way of coping with my grief, as I knew that reading books removes sorrow from the heart.
Mark's friend had passed away, and he found that all things grow with time except grief, as he slowly learned to cope with the loss and cherish the memories they shared.
Nevertheless, he copes.
words.defineEn: to handle a difficult circumstance and deal with it successfully
words.defineVi: để xử lý một tình huống khó khăn và đối phó với nó thành công

examples: It's not taking a trip down memory lane or longing and yearning for the good old days or fond memories of what's no more.
Many of us have fond memories of our childhoods.
We said a fond farewell to each other.
Is it fond?
So we have fond memories of that too.
words.defineEn: showing or having affections for a person
words.defineVi: thể hiện hoặc có tình cảm với một người

examples: That hot guy had a good head on his shoulders.
The hotel had expensive rates during the holiday season.
The group has a new CD in the pipeline.
The police had the situation well in hand.
The theatre company has several new productions in the pipeline for next season.
words.defineEn: to be pregnant or give birth to a baby
words.defineVi: mang thai hoặc sinh em bé
